intro: Osteocarpum, commonly known as the bonefruit, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Capparaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Osteocarpum spinosum, which is native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Its fruits are typically small, fleshy berries that contain seeds. Osteocarpum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
